column3:
<UIForeground>F201FC</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FD</UIGlow> Quest Sync<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>
The green gleaner seems to want a word with you.
Excuse me, but aren't you the one who was assisting Erenville? If you have a moment, I could also use some help with a certain task...
Simply put, I'm to hunt down a number of caribou. But as this is the first job I've accepted which requires any degree of violence, I'm not entirely confident in how I should approach my prey.

You seem like the type of <If(PlayerParameter(4))>woman<Else/>man</If> who's seen <If(PlayerParameter(4))>her<Else/>his</If> fair share of combat─what if I could observe you from concealment while you engage my target fauna!?
I wouldn't need you to spend all day on it, of course─one or two examples in the forest west of here should be plenty! Let's say two, shall we? I'll even pay you! ...Please?
The caribou shouldn't give you too much trouble. And if they do, well...that will also teach me a valuable lesson!
Thank you for the instruction! While I doubt I could emulate your particular style, seeing you in action was enormously helpful.

You've also provided a service by culling a few of Labyrinthos's more prolific animals. Lest you worry, it's essential we reduce the caribou's numbers every now and again to maintain a stable habitat.
And nothing here is killed for mere sport. Every part of a carcass is harvested and put to use─a practice I will make sure to carry out with the creatures you slew.
There are still a few more that need culling, but I think I can handle that on my own now. Such is the gleaner's lot, and I should learn how to do it sooner rather than later.
Oh, and here's your payment. Wish me luck!
